body_html:
@yaroslavvb Hi Yaroslav, I was hoping to get some help implementing the method discussed in https://arxiv.org/pdf/1510.01799.pdf.

@goodfeli suggested the pseudocode below:

examples = tf.split(batch)
weight_copies = [tf.identity(weights) for x in examples]
output = tf.stack(f(x, w) in zip(examples, weight_copies))
cost = cost_function(output)
per_example_gradients = tf.gradients(cost, weight_copies)

But I'm not sure how to implement this still. Would it be possible to show a toy example of this?

@goodfeli suggested the pseudocode below:

But I'm not sure how to implement this still. Would it be possible to show a toy example of this?
body:
@yaroslavvb Hi Yaroslav, I was hoping to get some help implementing the method discussed in https://arxiv.org/pdf/1510.01799.pdf.

@goodfeli suggested the [pseudocode](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/4897) below:
```
examples = tf.split(batch)
weight_copies = [tf.identity(weights) for x in examples]
output = tf.stack(f(x, w) in zip(examples, weight_copies))
cost = cost_function(output)
per_example_gradients = tf.gradients(cost, weight_copies)
```

But I'm not sure how to implement this still. Would it be possible to show a toy example of this?
